review: Based on the reviews, I'd say I'm in the minority here, and perhaps my Chromecast is actually defective. But I know that many other users are having trouble streaming Netflix, which is promised to work. I became so fed up with the thing that I decided to return it, but I'm a charitable man, so I decided to give it one last shot, and guess what? Now it works not at all!!! Garbage. It also doesn't support Amazon Prime, which I was aware of when I bought it, but since it doesn't work with Netflix either (when it's working at all) I feel it's to be avoided. I would suggest that people shell out the extra dough for the Amazon Fire apparatus, which will play many things, including Amazon Prime.****As an addendum, let me say that I gave this several more chances--it works some days and not others, and I need to set it up from scratch every time I try to use it. That being said, it appears to work well for a great many people, so give it a trial run and perhaps you'll be delighted. If not, send it back.Best wishes, all.GF
author: T. Peterson "TJP"

review: It wasn't clear to me that the apps had to be enabled with Chromecast feature in order to stream to the chromecast. I thought anything on phone could be streamed, but thats not the case (ads lead you to believe that). I have Euronews app on Phone and iPad, but the app doesn't have streaming to chromecast built in, so I cannot stream it to TV with cell phone. Only the limited number of apps (ie Youtube) can be stream directly. The options increase when using a PC since the chromecast option can be installed on your browser on PC versions, but I haven't see chromecast browsers on Android or iOS.
